game.user

Class SimPlay

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.user.SimPlay

  • public class SimPlay
extends java.lang.Object
    Class used to simulated different conditions on the Hex game. Different methods simulate different conditions: one player (test winning conditions), two human players (to test winning and input conditions) and two "dumb" players, using random moves.
    Version:
    1.1, 03.03.2021
    Author:
    Carlos Granados

      Constructor and Description
      SimPlay()

      static void two_players(int board_size)
      Static method to run the code for two (human) players.
      static void verify_coords(int board_size)

    • Method Detail

      • verify_coords

        public static void verify_coords(int board_size)
        Static method to verify that the CoordBoard Class is working as desired
        Parameters:
        board_size - The size of the Hex board

      • verify_one

        public static void verify_one(int board_size)
        Static method to check if the Player class can verify when a player wins the match.
        Parameters:
        board_size - The size of the Hex board

      • two_players

        public static void two_players(int board_size)
        Static method to run the code for two (human) players. It is used to test the winning conditions, in the presence of two players and the input of the coordinates of each player
        Parameters:
        board_size - The size of the Hex board

      • two_players_rnd

        public void two_players_rnd(int board_size,
                            int num_sim)
        Method used to generate 2 "dumb" players, which will use random generated moves in the board. At the end it generated a small statistic of the winning moves, mainly of the 1st moves. All results are shown in the screen and written down to a file.
        Parameters:
        board_size - The size of the Hex board
        num_sim - Number of simulations to perform
